meanings.definition: To take small bites or gentle bites
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will nibble on the carrot slowly.
meanings.sent2: She likes to nibble on popcorn while watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The hamster decided to nibble on the pencil, mistaking it for a snack.
meanings.sent4: As the squirrel began to nibble on the acorn, it seemed to be savoring every moment.
meanings.sent5: The baby bird learned to nibble on seeds from its mother.

meanings.sent1: He took a nibble of the cookie and smiled.
meanings.sent2: The cheese platter had a variety of delicious nibbles.
meanings.sent3: The cat's favorite nibble was the fish-flavored treat.
meanings.sent4: She offered her friend a nibble of the chocolate bar.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel enjoyed every nibble of the nut.

meanings.definition: To eat or chew in small bites
meanings.sent1: The hamster will nibble on the sunflower seeds.
meanings.sent2: It's fun to nibble on crackers during a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to nibble on the shoe laces.
meanings.sent4: She would nibble on the apple slices throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The child would nibble on the sandwich slowly.

meanings.definition: To show cautious interest or attention
meanings.sent1: The deer cautiously nibbled at the grass in the clearing.
meanings.sent2: She would nibble at the idea of going on a roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The detective began to nibble at the clues, trying to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: He would nibble at the thought of asking her out on a date.
meanings.sent5: The student would nibble at the new concept, trying to understand it better.

meanings.definition: A small, cautious bite or taste
meanings.sent1: She took a nibble of the new dish to see if she liked it.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel's nibble on the acorn was quick and careful.
meanings.sent3: The child's nibble of the medicine was followed by a funny face.
meanings.sent4: He couldn't resist taking a nibble of the freshly baked cookie.
meanings.sent5: The bird's nibble of the worm was precise and deliberate.
